text: Vintage 12. Thanks to Matt for this awesome brew! Partagée en compagnie de Marc-André. Robe pourpre tel un vin que le temps a oublié au fond dune cave. Une mousse à la framboise sur laquelle on a versé un coulis au chocolat. Du pépin de framboises presque acidulé et suret accompagné dun corps riche et trapu. Beaucoup dalcool en sentend malgré laquelle le tout se boit dangereusement bien, tant quon ne cherche pas à le boire comme une bière. Il faut appréhender le verre à la manière dun digestif. On ne boit que très rarement des breuvages qui se rapprochent de ceci.

18/IV/17 - 12.7 Fl. Oz. bottle @ American BBQ Guy Tasting (ElManana+1s place) - BB: n/a, 2014 vintage (2017-469) Thanks to Elmana+1 for sharing the bottle!
Clear reddish to rusty brown beer, small irregular off-white to beige head, bit bubbled, unstable. Aroma: lots and lots of raspberry jam, sugary impression. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: very sweet, alcohol, fruity touch, bit sugary, raspberry jam. Aftertaste: alcohol, raspberry, sugary, sweet, more alcohol, slightly acidic, bit sour.

Murky dark amber color with a bit of tan foam. Aroma has raspberries with brown sugar, caramel malt and toasted notes. Taste starts sweet and fruity with raspberry jam, sticky malt and sugar, slightly tart fruity finish. Medium, syrupy sticky body with low carbonation. The raspberry notes go very well with the sweet, malty flavors.

Bottle from Clint (starcross) -- thanks a ton, buddy! This is substantially harsher than I was expecting. The raspberry flavor and aroma is readily apparent, but its surprisingly medicinal, to the point of smelling and tasting artificial. The malt base is hot, giving off booze and intense caramel sweetness. I shared this with about 6 employees of a local brewery, and it was a struggle to finish it. As one person in the group put it, "this tastes like a discontinued Yankee Candle that was NyQuil flavored."
Bardzo syropowe, trochę jak miód pitny/nalewka z malinami. Słodkie, kwaskowate, cudnie owocowe.

The foam just goes around the rim. Medium brown amber color. Very big sweet malty nose with burnt raisins, raspberries, brown sugar, brandy, Christmas cake. Very full body, tons of raspberries, chocolate, Christmas cake, very sticky malty mouth. Super low carbonation. Boozy but so delectable and rich. Lingering I had this last time in 2008 and it is just as good.

Pours mahogany, not much foam but well, thats not what you look for in this beer. Aroma is full of raspberry jam, pure, fresh raspberry jam that I would like to take and just speed on a freshly baked and still warm bread and drink some cold milk next to it. Sweet and sticky, dense and warming. Taste is also full on raspberry, sweet, jammy, body is still somewhat dry. Alcohol comes out in the finish, some alcohol bitterness there. More raspberries in the finish. Game on, RBs best Fruit Beer, I dig you!

Butelka, bottlesharing w Piwotece. Wow, co się tu dzieje! Full malin, syrop malinowy, miód. Smak bardzo słodki, stropowy, malinowy ale bardzo przyjemne. Gęste, gładkie, alkohol świetnie ukryty. Znakomite piwo, ciekawe podejście do tematu.

2016 bottle from brewery... Hazy reddish purple in color... Aroma is raspberry lozenges, fruit candy, some cough syrup, caramel... Flavor is chocolate covered raspberries, caramel, fruit candy, lots of chocolate on finish... light alcohol burn on palate... really nice

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from 2014. Amber with no head. Raspberries and malty tones. Fruit, caramel and bitterness. Full body with a long fruity / malty finish.

UPDATED: DEC 22, 2016 December 21, 2016. Bottle, vintage 2014. 
Reddish brown with a minimal tan head. Aroma is fruity with lots of jammy raspberries, toffee, caramel, toffee, caramel, some nutty notes, hints of leathery dried fruits. Taste is sweet malty and fruity. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet toffee, caramel, jammy berries, some dried fruits and a touch of vanilla. 
Nice!
A: Deep red/brown coloured with a thin off white head N: Raspberry, caramel, fudge T: Raspberry candy, caramel O: Quite complex flavours with raspberry forward.
Bottle shared. Pours a dark clear ruby with no head. Raspberry jam, candy, honey, caramel sweetness, compot, sweet malts, syrup. Very sweet, pretty boozy. Full body, low carbonation. Amazing.
Bottle shared at deansos. Clear dark ruby pour with a light tan head. Tons of raspberries, raspberry jam, tart fruit and honey. Light alcohol spiciness, warm mouthfeel.

Wednesday tasting at deansos. Clear dark brown with almost no head. Big sweet fruity and alcoholic. Candy sweet. Toffe, hardcandy, dark caramels. Honey. Big sweet, light bitter. Full body, no carbonation. Very lemonadey syruppy fruity. Y-y. Strong alcoholic. Nice sweet.

Bottle shared, 2012 vintage. Almost clear deep red with small dark pink head. Massive raspberry jam, bitter herbs, sweet red fruits, vanilla, toffee, quite alcoholic, marmalade. Very sweet but also quite some alcoholic bitterness. Full bodied with soft carbonation. Very nice, but glad to share this beast!
Damn I was gone but this is awesome. Sweet, though not cloying, rich and enveloping, full bodied. Itll get ya drunk

Bottle shared at Au Revoir Tokyo. Thanks Gregg! Epic one here. Huge dry raspberry nose with some cherry and wood notes. Smooth as honey on the palate with a lovely lingering raspberry liqueur flavor. Alcohol was hidden so well. Fantastic stuff!

(Kuhnhenn Raspberry Eisbock) Bottle 375 ml, red waxed cap, vintage 2012. Served into a snifter at home, ABV 15.5%
Dark red to light brown colour on the body, murky, with a small and thin, tan coloured film covering the surface, with low retention.
Aroma is intense raspberries, caramel, alcohol after a deep sniff, syrup, some dark fruits in there too.
Taste has malty sweetness with lots of alcohol, some vanilla even, dark fruits, red fruits, molasses, syrup, plenty of raspberries.
Medium thick body, soft carbonation, sticky on the palate.
Pretty good and a nice sipper on a cold evening.

Just cracked opened the 2012 bottle. Pours a very dark ruby with a very faint off white head that immediately fades. Aroma is a huge raspberry and dark fruity aroma with almost a little bourbon aroma. Mouthfeel is a thick clingy full body desert wine like. Flavors with off course raspberry, some caramel, toffee, dark fruits, herbal notes. Huge complex beer. Cants believe it's 15.5%. Incredible beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle from a trade. Many thanks! Hazy red/orange colour, no foam. Sweet nose of raspberries, syrupy, tich mouth feel. Sweet and fruity. Almost no carbonation. Ok but a tad too sweet.

4300th review! 375 ml bottle into tulip glass; 2014 vintage bottling. Pours lightly hazy/cloudy deep ruby red/brownish color with a small light khaki head with decent retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Minimal lacing on the glass, with some light streaming carbonation. Aromas of huge tart/juicy raspberries, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, molasses, raisin, plum, cherry, fig, date, red wine, toasted brown bread, nuttiness, chocolate, cocoa, wood, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Incredible aromas with fantastic complexity and balance of raspberries, dark/bready malt, and fruity/earthy yeast notes; with great strength. Taste of huge tart/juicy raspberries, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, molasses, raisin, plum, cherry, fig, date, red wine, toasted brown bread, nuttiness, chocolate, cocoa, wood, and yeast/toasted earthiness. Light fruity/tannic tartness and woody/roast bitterness on the finish; with lingering notes of raspberry, dark fruit, caramel, toffee, brown sugar, molasses, toasted brown bread, nuttiness, chocolate, cocoa, wood, and yeast/toasted earthiness on the finish for a while. Incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, dark/bready malt, and fruity/earthy yeast flavors; with a great malt/fruit/tartness balance and zero cloying sweetness after the finish. Light dryness from acidic/tannic notes as well. Light carbonation and very full bodied; with a very slick/syrupy, fairly smooth, and lightly acidic/tannic balanced mouthfeel that is great. Alcohol is very well hidden with only a pleasant warmth lingering after the finish; with zero booziness. Overall this is an insane fruited eisbock style! All around incredible complexity, robustness, and balance of raspberries, dark/bready malt, and fruity/earthy yeast flavors; very smooth and easy to sip on for the enormous ABV. A highly amazing offering all around.
Bottle. Pour is red with a white head..Nose is jam, raspberry lollipop, sweetness, ..Taste is raspberry candy, spice, sweetness, candy, alcohol is hodden..

Bottle at the End of an Era tasting at ABC Beers, Den Haag, courtesy of Jeroen. Batch 5. Poured a clear dark amber with a bubbly round head. The aroma is fake sugar, raspberry. The flavour is moderate sweet, light sour with a yeast raspberry citrus, light acid palate. Medium to light bodied with average carbonation.

2012 bottle: Pours clear reddish brown with no head. And I mean no head. The nose is big on rød sodavand. Makes no sense if you are not from denmark. Raspberry sweetness and cherry sauce. Darn delicious I must says. Taste: fruity bock with a big malty body but the tart fruit is on top of things. A little spicy oak too. The aftertaste is rather hot from the booze but the finish is back to the fruits. Propper ass boss pour too thanks to motherbrother. Cheerio fella!

2012 vintage, thanks a lot mr. Dunt for this. 
Pour a reddish chesnut brown, with absolutely no head. 
Aroma is jam packed with raspberry jam, dark caramel, vanilla, toffee, almonds. Really a Big ol malt back, with the fruity jam from the raspberry. 
Taste is pretty darn sweet, with faint bitter hints - not from hops, but roasted malts/bitter chocolate-like stuff. 
Body is pretty full and oily, with as good as no carbonation. A Big boy beer for sure, with rather pronounced alcohol traces and slight burn. A little over the top splittin this two way
375ml bottle of 2014 release. Pours a reddy brown color without any head. Sticky but not overly sweet. Mellow raspberry without any seed bitterness. Rich maltiness.

6 oz. bottle. 2007 bottle. Originally reviewed in March 2013. Thick sludgy pond water. No carbonation. Slight red tinge to the brown.

Smell is milk chocolate and raspberry. Strong alcohol. Smells like a raspberry chocolate candy.

Much stronger raspberry flavor. Really chocolatey. Straight forward but excellent. Oxidation is present. Slightly bitter earthy flavor. Could be cardboard but it isnt offensive.
Very boozy. Still hot. No carbonation. Heavy.

This is incredibly good. Looking forward to the new one.

Have had 2004, 2007, little nip bottles along with on tap at GABF a few years back behind the pour stations pour after pour and the most resent batch. Pours out a muddy pinkish amber a little bubble head. Sweet raspberries some chocolate and booze. Taste is amazing rich raspberries chocolate and a nice sweetness. I am a big fan of the older ones over the new one. We did a side by side 2014 and 2007. The 2007 killed it!!!
Bottled shared at Todds. Sticky syrup boozy raspberry stuff. Brown ish in color. 2014 bottle.

2012 edition. Pours thick with little head retention and a dark deep purple. Huge aromas of raspberries as they have held up nicely. Faint whiffs of burnt sugar and toasted biscuit. Very fruit forward, very sweet, but in a delicate way. Though it is sweet, the background flavors of chocolate and wafers help to give it depth. Sip slow and let it warm up, this is better room temperature.

Dark ruby with a small pale head. Aroma is raspberry jam, plum, strawberry. Full bodied, sweet and syrupy on the palate, long fruity finish with a warming finish. Taste is raspberries, raspberry jam, plums, caramel. So tasty.

11.7oz bottle shared to snifter. I have been after this delicious offering for some time and it finally came to fruition. the pinkish liquid with no head and soft carbonation was such a delight on the nose so much raspberry and light chocolate notes. the flavor reminded me of raspberry cough syrup in a good way. yes it is a bit cloying in the raspberry sweetness but it was so good with hints of chocolate and caramel. it was so intense and finished with a nice booze warmth. so happy got to share this one finally. hats off kuhnhenn.

From old notes. From tap at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Red color with pink head. Fruity aroma, raspberry - berries - cherries, malty, caramel and chocolate notes. Heavy sweet taste like aroma. Medium to full oily sticky body with flat carbonation.

12.7oz bottle in a tulip. Pours deep amber with a small head. Aroma of raspberries, some dark chocolate, some caramel and sweet malts, and hints of alcohol. Flavor an incredible blend of everything with strong raspberry, chocolate, and caramel. Smooth texture. A very cool beer.
Strong smell, very sweet. Kinda think tasting. Cant taste the alcohol really. Pretty good!

2012 bottle, thanks to ineedbeer Pours dark and cloudy ruby brown with no head. Aroma is raspberries and some vanilla. Flavour is sweet, a mixture of port wine and dessert liquor. Full bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Finish is sweet and lots of raspberries coated with sugar. A slow sipper.

2012 bottle
Thanks to Owen for the bottle

Raspberry brown color, just a thin collar. No head
Nose is chocolate covered raspberry. Enticing nose and almost perfect in the balance, 
Taste is chocolate, caramel, tart raspberry. Tastes like the old school cherry redskins in every way. Just a slight bit syrupy and a bit boozy but otherwise a sublime beer. Fun to sip.
Finally!!!!! Something from Kuhnhenn that I really like. If you like raspberry at all you need to go get this.

Bottle shared at the Cotteridge convention, 24/01/2015. Huge thanks to Colin Bois for this one. Nice reddy / caramel brown coloured pour with a halo of head.Aroma is lovely sweet vanilla, cherry bakewell, aspberry, tart and sweet. Flavour is full and sweet, honey, cherry and rasopberry druits, smooth sweet and mellow. Palate is fairly sweet, viscous,. Really good.

Bottle, shared. 2014 version. Pours dark but clear red, slight pink ring of foam. Massive raspberry jam, hint of nuts and chocolate. Holy god, this is boozy. Like iced raspberry cider. Pretty dang impressive considering the abv and freshness. To the cellar.

2012 Bottle, huge thanks to ICEatALAMO for this one. Popped open by myself to celebrate a 4.0 semester.

Pours a deep burgundy/red with a small off-white head. Aroma is raspberries, chocolate, caramel, just a touch of alcohol, quite similar to Chambord. Taste follows suit, with lots of chocolate/raspberry goodness, with a roasty chocolate finish. Alcohol is pretty much non-existent considering the ABV; super easy to drink. Beautiful beer.
Bottle - Pours dark red. The nose is boozy, raspberry, slight chocolate. Taste was pretty smooth, lots of raspberry, malty, boozy.
2014 bottle, pour is murky brown. tastes like a liquid chocolate raspberry tootsie roll, only downfall is a bit of heat, looking forward to a vintage one

Bottle, 2012 vintage. Shared at Dangerous Bottle Share 8.0. Pour is dirty reddish with some tiny lacings. Nose has raspberry!!! Sweet filled chocolates and some vanilla. Taste is very much like a fruity port wine, raspberries, slight alcohol burn, chocolate, sherry and a light tartness.

Shared at Dangerous Bottleshare #8. Pours cloudy reddish brown with no haed. Aromas of sweet cherries, raspberries, caramel, chocolate, vanilla, liquor filled chocolate sweets, barley notes, light boozy heat. Taste is pretty jammy, sweet raspberries, chocolate, port wine, oaky dry, vanilla and some alcohol that does not do in any way harm this delicious brew! Very unique.

Bottle shared @ dangerous bottleshare #8 . 2012 vintage. Pours hazy ruby red or murky brown depending on which glass I looked upon. no head either way. Aroma of nice and sweet raspberries, a lot of chocolate, vanilla, gummy bears and liquor filled sweets. A lot of port wine notes as well. Smells like a dessert liquor in some form. The taste also has a lot of sweet raspberries, chocolate, port wine, wood, weak jam, caramel, vanilla and some delicate alcoholic notes. Nice flat and oily body which suits it well. This is seriously something else! A great sipper imo.

Bottle at Dangerous Bottleshares #8, thanks to Baron! Pours a dark, deep reddish, slightly murky brown with almost no head. Aroma has lots of raspberries, alcohol, cherry, sweet fruity notes, huge malty sweetness, chocolate, the liqour that you fill in chocolates, port wine. Taste is a nice, sweet mix of raspberries and chocolate, lots of booze in a nice way, again elegant port wine notes. Not overwhelming, but still very intense! This lived up to my expectations for sure! Low carb and full, oily body.

6 Apr 2015, bottle. dark pink and clear. nose is super sweet and raspberry syrup. thick and syrupy. really tastes just like raspberry syrup. there is a beery finish but it really is all sugary sweet raspberry syrup.

375 ml bottle. 2012 vintage. So big thank you to deyholla! Cheers Derek! 
Clear dark red colour with no head.
Raspberries, dessert wine, dark chocolate, a hint if sweetness (yeast brings more sweet raspberries) and some fruit cake notes in the aroma. 
The flavour is strong... with raspberry, dessert wine, chocolate, mild bitterness, sweetness and some dryness. 
Wow! This is really enjoyable. A truly balanced beer. Rich and complex enough. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours into a deep dark red color with a foamy head. A creamy raspberry jam aroma with a chocolate back note. Big jammy flavors with the return of slight Chocolate layers. Slightly tart. The alcohol turns it into a sipper yet delicious and unique in its own.

Bottle from Sam! Thanks...brotha! The pour is deep red, almost deep purple. No real head or lace. The aroma is powerful dark raspberries and blackberries. A rather jam aroma but with a boozeness to it. SOme hints of chocolate. The taste is immediate strong raspberry, almost jam like. Some notes of dark chocolate and cordial. Strong booze, medium to thin body, low carb. The flavors are amazing.

2014 Batch. I was super excited to try this for years, but man did it disappoint. Smells like raspberry medicine, tastes about the same. It grows on you a bit as you drink but damn is this medicinal. 4 of us struggled to finish a bottle.

Bottle split at the Cotteridge Convention, from an IP trade with Jredmond - cheers James, 24/01/15.
Murky redish amber with a crimson top.
Nose is sticky raspberries, berry fruit, sweet tunes, Neopolitan ice cream.
Taste comprises raspberry syrup, lightly spiced backnotes, sweet, berry jam redux.
Full bodied, viscous, warming alcohol in a sweet fruit finale.
Solid stuff for style and concept, easy sipper but a little too sweet, cant say Id have this anywhere near the top 50 beer list personally!
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: 2012 vintage picked out of the cellar by my wife for her 39th birthday. Pours an absolute deep ruby colour. No real head or lace. Nose is super sweet fruity, obviously raspberry, a bit of booziness. Tastes sweet, there is a touch of chocolate taste and smell, its boozy though, has some little bitterness, malt, and a firey finish. I like this but it gives me some heartburn too, and I can feel it rather quickly.

(Cuvée 2014): Ramassé à la brasserie au début de notre traversée. Un nez de fleurs trempées dans la confiture de framboises très sucrées. En bouche cest ridiculement sirupeux et sucré. Avec le temps ça se complexifie superbement, des notes boisées sortent de la chaleur dalcool et contribuent à la chaleur. Le côté sirop est trop important pour la mettre sur un piédestal, Jaurais été très curieux de goûter les précédentes cuvée.

UPDATED: MAR 6, 2015 Tap @ Kuhnhenn: 2013 vintage. Rich ruby red color with a tawny brown centers; a thick, creamy, fine-bubbled beige head settles into a foamy collar after just a couple moments. Aroma is a chocolate covered raspberry dessert onslaught. Bursting with super-sweet & ever so slightly tart raspberry jam & raspberry compote, with underscores of dense bakers chocolate, red grape, & a robust boozy presence. Very fresh, inviting, decadent, & dessert-like. Flavor is no different. Huge river of raspberry puree & raspberry preserves sliding across the palate on a board of dark chocolate & booze. Tastes like a raspberry jam filled chocolate cake. Only, dipped in a big vat of booze before being served. Its heavy & robust, but given that its somewhere between 13-16% ABV, a little heat is to be expected. Given the ABV, its actually pretty "easy" drinking. Often served in small samples, which is perfect. A lovely beer to pair with dessert. Or an evening full of regrettable decisions. Your call.
2007 vintage: Slightly more tart & a little bit thinner. Less of a chocolate presence. Not as decadent. A little more sherry-esque booze to this one, possibly from mild oxidation? Overall still a great beer but fresher is better.
2014 vintage: Opposite of the 07 vintage, this one has much more chocolate to it. Makes me think of those Tootsie Pops. The raspberry flavored one, of course. Booze is truncated nicely, yet still provides some warmth so you dont slam this high gravity eisbock like a fucken idiot. Really nice release this year.
Bottle at Craigs. Sweet fruity raspberry chocolate smell. Syrupy light raspberry taste.

Bottle cotteridge pissup. Red thin head. Aroma is raspberry jam taste is same raspberry ice cream juice so sweet it make your teeth hurt some tartness nice alcohol warmth coming through. Nice syrupy body. I love the sweet stuff right up my street. I thought this would be the beer of night however that was short lived as the next beer new glarus Belgian red somehow managed to be even more sweeter and moreish. Still Very very good!

Bottle Share at Cotteridge 24/1/15.
Deep dark Ruby with little head, Raspberry presence, Chocolate and Caramel notes, very drinkable but a little sweet. Went down nice and smooth..

Bottle share at Cotteridge Wines. Big thanks to Colin. Dark red, hazy, no head at all. Aroma is light raspberry, red wine, molasses, oxidation. Body is medium, rich, no real carbonation. Taste is malty, pretty sweet, tart raspberry, background oxidation like an old barley wine. This is definitely a sharing beer - I couldnt drink half a bottle of this.

24th Jan 2015: Cotteridge Wine meeting. Cheers Colin for sharing this, the sweetest beer of the day by a country mile. If you like lashings of raspberry jam on your toast this is your beer heaven, however I found it just too syrupy for my delicate palate and my sample was enough for me.

Bottled, sampled at The Cotteridge Convention, many thanks to Theydon_Bois for this one. Reddish brown with off white head. Really sweet and jammy raspberry beer, syrupy, quite smooth. It really is the drinkable version of Raspberry Jam. Its fine but a little too much for me.
Bottle share. Cotteridge Beano. Sweet. Smooth. Rich, and boozy. Raspberry jam. Some relief by way of some light tartness. Overall, too sweet for me.

Bottle at Cotteridge wine convention; hazy light red/copper pour with a thin bubbly white head, raspberry aroma, taste has ripe fruit, jammy, some cherries, very sweet and sticky but nice, great blended with Armand 4 Lente for some sweet and sour action.
Bottle at cotteridge tasting 24/1/15, cheers Theydon!fruity raspberry, warming,hot, raspberry ham, Victoria sponge, full bodied, light in mouth, dark crimson with white lacing.
375ml bottle. Pours dark reddy orange with a thin head. Aroma is raspberry jam on burnt toast. Taste is sweet and jammy. Touch of toast.

Clear dark red colour, off-white head. Aroma of raspberry, cherry, red fruits, raspberry candy, malts, caramel, chocolate and raisins. Sweet flavour, caramel, raspberry candy, concentrated cherry, syrup and chocolate cake. Quite alcoholic, full body. Finish hot alcohol, fruity, sweet. Quite a beer for people with a sweet tooth. Well made and out of the ordinary, still, too sweet for me. Could see this work brilliantly with dessert though.(from 37.5cL bottle during Oudjaarsticken 2014. vintage 2012. Thanks for bringing and sharing the bottle, JulienHuxley, its much appreciated!)

Bottle, 2012 vintage, thnx to lionsandbeer for sending me this! Pours clear pinkish beer without any head on top. Aroma is very fruity, loads of raspberry and booze. Not very complex, but very intense. Flavor has again loads of raspberry, booze but also some sugary notes and even some chocolate in there. Very syrupy and sticky. No carbonation going on here, but very full bodied and great flavors going on here. Aftertaste is very sweet and boozy. 
Very heavy stuff, but I love it.
Loads of raspberry, very sweet. Taste is much, much better, sticky sweet, raspberry, even some chocolate, rye. Ending is best. (Oudejaarsticken. Shared by Julien, many thanks!)

37.5cl Bottle, 2012 edition, generously shared by JulienHuxley. Clear deep reddish/purplish amber colour, thin pink head. Aroma of booze, sticky raspberry candy, candy, sweet cherries. Flavour is very sweet, raspberry candy, syrup, caramel, boozy, hot alcohol, sticky sweet finish. Full-bodied. Nice as a liqueur, but way overrated IMHO. Very one-dimensional and sickly sweet.

Pours a dark red color, no head. Aroma is lots of raspberry and some booziness. Flavor is tart raspberry and sweet chocolate. Has a wine-like mouthfeel. Warming and soothing as you drink it. Very good.

Bottle - Fresh - Raspberry and cocoa. Deep Amber hue. Raspberry, chocolate, light boozy and heat on the thought. Big rich and sweet, I would like to try with some age. At this price point, I may be tempted to buy something else in maybe a liquor.

UPDATED: FEB 27, 2015 (draft @ Kuhnhenn Brewing Company - Warren, MI - 2012 vintage) Pink pour with a soapy head. Straight raspberry syrup in the aroma. Flavor is much too sweet. All raspberry with no chocolate that I could detect. Sad to say but its way too sweet. Thankfully I have a bottle of 2004 to try at a later date.
__________________________________

The 2004 bottle was no better. Sad to say but this just isnt a good beer.

On tap at kuhnhenn. Aroma of raspberry jam, some hay, fig. Appears ruby red, nearly no foam or lace. Tastes of a balanced tart and sweet raspberry jam, followed by a barely unbalanced hayish hop bitterness; the 15.5% ABV is very well hidden, tastes more like a 6.5 to 8.0 % ABV. Palate is light, a little fizzy. Overall, very nice.

UPDATED: JAN 28, 2015 Tap. Dark ruby black. Slight bubbles. Subtle nose of raspberry jam. Syrupy. Tart raspberry, raspberry jam, mild chocolate. Very complex. ABV doesn?t taste as strong as it is (15.5 in 2014)...but you taste it!
Rating #300 :-) Thanks to Plovmand. Dark red with no head. Aroma is raspberry, cherry and dark chocolate. Taste is raspberry and chocolate. Almost no carbonation.
2012 bottle to teku. Deep reddish brown. Low carb. Tootsie pop in a glass. Cherry, raspberry, chocolate. Sweet delicious nectar.

Dark reddish brown pour from a 2012 bottle (15.5%). Very little off white head. Massive raspberry fruit nose - wow. So much yum. Chocolate and caramel in the taste with some excellent raspberry fruit, like an expensive, boozy truffle. Wonderfull.
UPDATED: JAN 7, 2017 Bottle at Darkness Day. Rich sweet raspberry element to this. Super good. So glad I got to try it!

Rating #800. Bottle sent by Chris. Thanks!

A: So red it has nearly turned black. No head, almost looks flat - though there was a rise before the fall there. Leggy.

N: Enormous raspberry, and a hint of fruit-rollup. Cherry undertones. Port wine, leather, tobacco, and sugar laden grapes. Tootsie rolls show up in force. Complex and inviting. At least, I think so.

T: Big tootsie roll sweetness. Gigantic raspberry tartness. 

M: Treacly body. Big alcohol that still manages to feel light. Carb is prickly. 

O: My wife is not a fan. I had to drink all of hers, and I was very happy to do so. I liked the 2007 version of this, and I like the 2012. I would prefer the 2007, though, but thats neither here nor there.

On tap at Kuhnhenn. The pour is a beautiful deep ruby. Crystal clear with a light pink head that quickly dissipates to a small collar. The aroma is ALL raspberry. Delicious. You get the sweetness of a chocolate malt, and a light caramel that just blends so beautifully. There isn't strong booziness on the back end that is nice for a strong fruit beer. The flavor is pretty intense. There is a lot of booze. The raspberry and malts mesh well for a nice fruity complexion with just a hint of malt and then a blast of booze. That's the only thing I can really knock it on. The mouth feel is great. Viscousy and delicious. There is a minimal amount of carbonation, but it's good. The aftertaste is lingeringly fruity and malty. Just awesome

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Aroma is raspberry, caramel, candy, delicious, wonderful. Appearance is red, maybe a tinge of brown, absolutely no head to speak of. Taste is raspberry, caramel, chocolate, complex, booze. Mouthfeel is boozy, great carbonation, but its hard to get past the booze. Overall, a stunning beer, but somewhat disappointing for the hype.

Bottle from 2012. Pour is deep red/brown with a small tan head. Aroma of licorice, roast, raspberry syrup, and milk chocolate. Flavor is much heavier on the chocolate with notes of raspberry, dark chocolate, oak, roast malt, dark honey, and warming booze in the finish. Lingering taste of licorice and tart raspberry.

Ive had the 2007 version and the 2012 version and I really dont understand the hype behind this one at all. Both had a heavy licorice smell and the 2012 had a bit of a raspberry smell as well. Both tasted exactly like red Twizzlers licorice and Im really surprised to see nobody mentioning this given that both bottles I had tasted nearly identical to Twizzlers and Twizzlers have a very distinct flavor to them. I was hoping for heavy raspberries and got licorice instead. There was a slight raspberry taste to the 2012, but not a lot and not nearly as much as the Twizzlers licorice taste.

2012 Bottle, shared in a location remote to my dining room.
The beer almost looks as though still, with a deep reddish brown color. 

The aroma offers a huge raspberry character with some chocolate, some "mead like" honey, and some surprisingly mild booziness.

The flavor is enormously sweet, but its got a very true raspberry, even seedy raspberry flavor to it. Its boozy but surprisingly not boozy in an off putting way, the booze finds a way of being a warming as well as a balancing factor in the beer. Its got a whole bunch of chocolate character to it as well.

The beer is ridiculously viscous, just short of syrupy, and decidedly moth coating. 

I am not a lover of sweet drinks generally speaking, but Poltorak, Tokaji, Pedro Ximenez, & Ice Cider when well made are just as beautiful as any drink despite their almost impossible richness and overwhelming sweetness, this among the few beers that is to beer what those drinks are to their respective libations.

2012 version - 375 ml bottle at home. Pours clear dark amber, no head. Aroma is the perfect balance of brandy/cognac, raspberries and caramel. Medium palate with nice fruity sharpness of the raspberry, loads of rich sweetness but -bummer- the alcohol is really coming through in the end. Little smoke in the aftertaste is nice. Taste is close to rumtopf, a cherry soaked German alcohol specialty. Pity of the abundant alcohol.

2012 bottle opened in 2014. Murky red/brown pour with no head. Huge raspberry aroma here. I do get some muted chocolate notes. A little boozy. Fresh/concentrated raspberry flavor along with milk chocolate in the taste. Coats the tongue...ends with a fruit juice astringency. Tons of flavor here.

Bottle thanks to my good friend artmcd8 as a present. Poured dark hazy brown red with no head. Aroma super raspberry sweet jam. Light carb med bod. Jammy raspberry light tart taste. Complex. Pretty awesome.

On tap at Kuhnhenn Brewing Co., many times. Appearance is a vibrant and deep red. Ruby and pink hues. Medium carbonation provides a half-finger of off-white head that can be revived from the fine lacing with a couple swirls of the glass. Aroma is loaded with tart raspberry jam, coupled with rich caramel, vanilla and a slight alcohol. Taste has a great sweet/tart combination from the raspberry that is calmed by the full-bodied caramel and vanilla that follow. Sticky, syrupy and fulling coating of the palate. The alcohol almost sneaks by unnoticed, but can be detected in the warming finish. A true sipper and a great dessert beer. Kuhnhenn never fails to amaze me with their bold offerings.

2012 bottle; Pour is murky dark amber, with a very modest off white head into this glass. It retains poorly - but that was fairly expected. The nose is dominant raspberry tart, jam, juice - Theres an earthen note, with caramel and toffee presence here as well. The flavor profile is bittering, but mostly from the alcohol note thanks to the ABV. Its not entirely meshing well, and I bet it needed a little age. I could be wrong, but its not what I remember from a past vintage. Its medicinal, raspberry juice, moving to seeds and earthen oak presence - theres caramel and a hint of more toffee here. Therea also burnt sugar and a candy note here as well. Its interesting, its unbalanced - and I was expecting more.

Refrigerated 2010 winter release (three and a half years after bottling, 2007), 6.3 oz. brown bottle with red wax poured into a snifter, big thanks to Drake for trading me this top want. Pours translucent dark brown with crimson highlights and almost no head. Nice raspberry aroma, no carbonation, no lacing, smooth texture, and medium/thick body. Taste is caramel, some chocolate, some raspberry, and long vanilla finish. Expected more raspberry, abv is well covered, pretty easy to drink, but I hope this has more raspberry fresh.

2012. Dark orange-brown, very little head. Strong aroma, fruit, raspberries. Really sweet and thick. Tastes exactly like those French raspberry hard candies that come in a round tin. A pretty amazing beer, and a great experience to drink it. I guess I couldnt really get past how much it reminded me of those candies. Was hoping Id like it more.
Bottle share thanks to mcbacus.pours a cloudy brown, no head. For being like 7 years old, still get the raspberry. Tasty beer.

187ml bottle shared be mcbackus. 2007 bottle. Aroma is a fruity, vanilla, slightly oxidized. Pours a nearly flat reddish brown. Taste is a vanilla cream fruity pie goodness. Slightly sweet and a touch of alcohol warming. Really fantastic.

Bottle share thanks to Mcbackus. 2007 vintage. Murky, reddish brown, no head. Raspberry, semisweet, malty aroma, and then more raspberry aroma. Tons of raspberry juice, caramel, vanilla, slightly oxidized papery flavor.
Reddish light brown like pour no head. Chocolate covered raspberry aroma. All raspberry with chocolate taste in a medium body little carbonation. Little alcohol burn little syrupy.

2007 bottle thanks to Daniel. Pours a cloudy brown ruby with no head. The aroma is strong raspberry candy, tomato, and oak. Thin mouthfeel with strong acidic raspberry, tart, and very sweet finish. Very good.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2014 A huge thanks to ygtbsm94 for providing both 04 and 07 vintages. Pours a nearly still translucent burgundy with no head or lacing. Aroma is chocolate liqueur and dark fruits (raspberries, cherries). Flavor is more chocolate than raspberries, with vanilla notes. Overall very drinkable - alcohol is well-masked.  From notes 1/23/10 (Geist Dark Lord Tasting).

2004 Nip bottle shared with GT2 thanks to CaptainCougar- an old wedding present that we saved. Celebrating our first home! Bottle opens with no hiss, pour is murky deep brown and flat. Nose is oxidized, tawny port, black cherry, candied dark fruits, bourbon, simple syrup, sherry. Awesome- pretty much perfect. Taste is cranberry, milk chocolate, tootsie roll, diluted sherry. Finishes watery and papery. Over the hill.
bottle sampled at dark lord day. thank you to the stranger who poured me some. pours a hazy purple reddish with an off white head. raspberry cherry and a slight vanilla finish taste. amazing beer

Won this in Fantasy Football. Shared during DLD 14. Pours a cloudy purplish-brown body with a small off-white head. Aroma of raspberries, overly ripen apples lying in an apple orchard, alcohol and earthiness. Flavor of sweet, semi-tart raspberry, apple, chocolate, and caramel with a dry oak finish. Bit hot!
chocolate,caramel and fruit. aged profile the brew is strong and powerful in flavor and body. magnificent with vanilla the body is a bit of syrup with froth like a famous French dessert.

Drucken på fat på Mikkeller & Friends på Nörrebro. En glad överaskning att den var påkopplad. Söt alkholvarm hallondoft med vanilj, choklad och cognac. Stor kropp, rejäl sötma men inte sliskigt, snarare len och stor munkänsla, väldigt väl dold alkohol, inte alls spritigt men kraftig och värmande. En dessert i sig och riktigt gott. Fint att värma sig med en kylig vårdag.

Draught 15,5 abv.Dark Dark redish colour with no head.Aroma of milke chocolate,vanilla and really much raspbberries,good hidden strong alc,who not killes the good taste of raspbberries,full body and smooth mouthfeels really nice beer.

Fad: Bordeaux farvet øl med et meget lille skumhoved. Duften er let bourbon, vanilie og masser af hindbær. Smagen er igen meget kompleks med masser af hindbær men dog også en ordentlig gang alkohol. Øllen er simpelthen for varm af alkohol. Dejlig ø ellers.

Tap. Pours deep amber with a tiny beige head. Aroma of chocolate, toffee and rasberries. Sweet flavor that ends up more dry with alcohol. Full bodied, syrupy texture and soft to flat carb. A great and complex brew.

2012 bottle with daknole and Ibrew2or3. Nice earthy raspberry nose with milk chocolate and a weird Dr. Pepper tone. Pours a clear ruby-copper. A tart and sharp taste of dark berries grabs hold early, with chocolate-covered cherries, wet oak, and a hint of cognac emerging late. The alcohol is quite hidden; I never would have guessed the 15.5% ABV from the taste. A nice beer, but it falls short of the massive hype.

Pours hazy mahogany, minimal light tan head

Smell huge raspberry caramel, sweet

Taste sweet sugary raspberry, creamy

Big and complex, full body, minimal heat

Wow
Spirit rainbow coloured. Taste is likewise - doesnt feel like a fruity beer due to sweet fruitiness on finish and booze.
Incredibly well balanced, vanilla flavor. feels like a liquid dessert. Fits really well for pie pastry.

Unclear brown of color with an off with head. An aroma of raspberries, blackberries, black berries, sweet chocolate, sweets and and candy. A flavor of candy, raspberries, cherries, blackn currants and dry with weak sweets.

Bottle. 2007 version. Thx Svend/Enjoyit. Dark with beige head. Aroma of cocoa, raspberries, fruiit and dark malts. Tart, very tart. Also sweetness from berries with an alcoholic, yet mellow vinous flavour. This is as complet as it gets. Great, great beer.

Pour has little too no carbonation. Color of cranberry juice. Smells like rasberry syrup, toffee, malt??? Molasses thickness. Tart, Grapefruit, Tangerines rhines and strong raspberry. Burns going down. Tasty

Acquired in a trade, enjoyed with a friend which was probably a mistake. 2012 vintage should be shared 3 ways...very boozy.

A - Pours a translucent blood red to purple color. Very little head and fades fast.

S - Nose is loaded with bright fruitiness. Smells like a mix of Serendipity and Raspberry Tart from New Glarus.

T - Its really hard to get beyond the medicinal qualities of this. Cough syrup, throat drops and goose. But there was a lot of fruit like a salad with a ton of cherry, raspberry and apple. 

M - Thin, crisp and tart.

O - This is a very good beer but 2-3 ounces is more than enough.

Big thanks to Adam for getting this to me in trade. 2012 bottle with red wax poured in a Firestone Walker Teku on February 13, 2014. Pours bright and dark red with no head at all even with a vigorous pour. Huge sweet raspberry and booze aroma, some caramel or toffee, lots of sweet syrupy sugar smell. So much sweet berry. Flavor is sweet straight raspberry jam, and then some toffee like malts tingling the tongue with plenty of booze in the background. This is very sweet with a thick nearly syrupy mouthfeel but balanced with some light carbonation as to make it more drinkable. Huge flavors in this brew for sure. Made for the raspberry lover. Very nice and a bit hot.

2012 bottle. Dark red without carbonation. Holy sweet fruit aroma. Like Raspberry jam. Chocolate and caramel covered in raspberry. Not as sweet as I thought it would be. Remarkably drinkable for its ABV. Awesome.

Draft - from memory at MBGF 2013 , reddish pink pour , obviously raspberry aromas . Palate is sticky sweet almost syrupy . Big boozy and sweet . Interesting , couldn't drink a lot if this . 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. 2012 vintage. Massive jammy berries and light chocolate nose. Dark tea color with ruby highlights. Big range of explosive berry flavors right off / mid palate mellow into smooth sweet fruitiness / very lightly bitter in finish. Medium body with just a touch of astringency. Wonderful stuff. Such a collection of subtle fruit flavors. Doesnt overwhelm or bomb the tongue. Hides the alcohol very well. Great!

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 2012 Bottle. Huge raspberry nose, chocolate, pop tarts. Very impressive. Deep crimson, head immediately goes to lace. Big, sweet, raspberry, smooth and lovely. No alcohol presence, really. A bit tingly. Bitter finish. Very smooth and silky body with tight, prickly carbonation. Lovely. Delicious stuff. Lovely flavors last forever. Wonderful.
Bottle shared with northropfrye. This is the beer of my dreams! Enticing chocolate raspberry aroma and a taste to match. A bit booze, but very agreeable. Sweet and tart and rich. Yum!

UPDATED: DEC 30, 2013 Thanks, Tim, for this one! Maroon colour, very little head. Fabulous aroma of milk chocolate, raspberries, malt, vanilla, hard sweet candies. Taste is sweet raspberries but has a dark chocolate roast backbone to it. Considering this is 15.5 percent theres very little alcohol present. A lovely dessert beer.
Bottle in Vail. Thanks to adnielsen for sharing. Pours a dark red color with white head. Raspberry jam, slight alcohol aromas. Raspberry jam, pretty strong flavor. Definitely a sipper.

2012 bottle. Thanks Ryan! Pours a dark clear red with a small pink head. Aroma of fruit, malt, chocolate, and alcohol. Taste is raspberries, malt, chocolate, vanilla, and alcohol. Finish is dry, tart, and warming. Very nice to sip on.
2012 bottle at home. Clear, reddish brown. Awesome boozy raspberry aroma. Same raspberry taste. Sweet. Kind of feels like a boozed up New Glarus fruit beer. Great!

Bottle from blacknyellow (BA), thanks man. Dark ruby red semi transparent. Completly flat no carbonation. Aroma is raspberry puree and tootsie roll chocolate. Taste is chocolate raspberry and quite a bit of booze, although doesnt taste anywhere near as strong as 15.5%. More like 10%. Good stuff for sure but not for the price.

Draught @ Mikkeller & Friends. Pours unclear red with a minimal off-white head. Aroma is raspberries, booze, toasted malt, chocolate notes and toffee. Taste is intense, cloyingly sweet, near moderate bitter and light tart. Body is full, texture is thick and sticky, carbonation is soft. Finishes very sweet, boozy and burning with lingering raspberries and malt.

Hallontårta, choklad och maltig.
Mäktig kropp tydliga hallon. Spritig mot slutet men inte så det stör 
Varm, tung och riktigt fin. Söt. Hemma hos Micke som hjälpte till att fixa denna trade. (Thanks biggsbowler!)

Tap at Blind Tigers VSK night although been popping up all over city as of late. Pours bloody chocolate color. Nose is thick raspberry syrup and dark chocolate. If you have ever had a Godiva raspberry chocolate bar this tastes exactly like this blended up and mixed with cherry cough syrup and grain alcohol but all in a nice way. Its a bit too sweet and thick on palate for me but overall very tasty
Poured from bottle. Pours deep red in color with no head. Aroma is a raspberry tootsie roll pop. Taste is the same. Sweet as heck with lots of great raspberry and chocolate notes.

Bottle from T25 trade. Aroma and flavor is medicinal raspberry with limited sweetness and a caramel/cocoa aspect. Drink this with a big chocolate cake, and imagine you've mixed it with Purple Drank. It's great.

Shared bottle with Timfoolery and others. Very strong aroma of raspberry. Tastes of raspberry with hints of chocolate. We paired it with chocolate birthday cake. It cake takes away the medicinal characteristics from the beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A: Deep Ruby Hue, Passes Almost No Light, Thin White Head Ring, Minimal Lacing

S: Brandy, Raspberry Puree

T: Raspberries, Mildly Boozy, Tart Cherries

M: Average Carbonation, Medium Bodied, Semi Boozy, Lightly Sweet

Overall, a good raspberry eisbock but has some extra hype to it.
Tap @ Mikkeller Stefansgade .... It pours murky brown.. With no head ... Fantastic! Raspberry aroma and flavors with fruit, brown sugar... Full body! Awesome! Always love this!
On draft at Torst. Pours a syrupy and very still. rust in color.Potent raspberry nose with a hint of honey, caramel and cough syrup. As it warms up chocolate is present in the aroma.Very sweet

05-NOV-2013, draft @Mikkeller & Friends.
Dark, dark amber with low tan head at the rim but that also dies and even a vigorous swirl can not bring forward a head.
Aroma is deep chocolate dipped raspberry. Taste is loads of raspberries and alcohol all wrapped in chocolate.
Very full body, soft carbonation, long fruity tart and sweet finish. Very sweet. Like a good banyul. Fantastic drink.

On tap, probably newest vintage. Pours beautiful tawny red with a dissipating head. Aroma is heavy on raspberries at first glance, mingling with warming alcohol and pie crust-like sweet malt notes, shadowed by an amazing chocolate note. The pronounced alcohol and strong raspberry makes it more similar to a liquor or cocktail than a beer. Very nice aroma! The taste is also more similar to a liquor than a beer, cause it does not really have any bitterness, it has a huge sweetness, loads and loads of raspberries, and a strong warming alcohol, which are the two main dominant aspects. Some maltiness is tracable, towards a hint of caramel and maybe even chocolate. A real sipper. Drink this in stead of a desert wine or a port, cause it falla more along those lines than your typical sipper beer.

Tap. Unclear red with a small off white head. Lots of raspberry, raspberry syrup, caramel malt, warming alcohol, chocolate. Heavy sticky sweet, full body, soft carbonation. Big and sweet with lots of raspberries.

2012 vintage. Brownish red hued pour. Not much head. Nose is pretty heavy raspberry, sweet malt, and booze. Taste follows the nose and is very malt forward. Not as sweet as I was expecting. Still a bit hot and I would imagine this would age very well. Heavy on the palate. Very nicely done. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nip at Stephens. Vintage 2007; fuck yeah. Pours darker burgundy, maroon. Aroma is pungent fig, raison, carmalized plumb, musky, cardboard. Taste is big plumb, sweet dark raspberries, carmalized brown sugar. Finish is dark cherries with a slightly tangy note. Very nice, but not as good as the 2012, too much oxygen and not enough fruit.

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Eric. Huge thanks for this one man!! 2007 nip bottle. Huge, caramel, toffee, raisiny, figgy, slightly oxidated, dark fruits, red licorice, and stale bready aroma. Taste is much the same - tons of dark fruits, raisins, figs, plums, somewhat tangy, dark cherries, and bready with a touch of alcohol on the backend. Slick mouthfeel with no carbonation. Really cool to try and damn decent Eisbock, but the 2007 may be past its prime.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2013 2012 Vintage. Thick red wax. Bottle shared by Kraddel @ "I cannot believe that you brought your own beer to a beer festival" @ Modeste 2013. 375 ml. bottle sampled. Dark bright raspberry rhubar, bordeaux, basically no head. Nose is pure raspberry frangipane, raspberry jam cookies, huge, pure jam, very sweet in a good way, pure sugar, once again in a good way,... Warming raspberry cookie taste, caramel, very sweet, white sugar, lots in a very enjoyable way, warming, caramel, thick toffee, hint caramel, biscuite, warming, not boozy, hint chocolate chip cookie, pretty big, hard to do the bottle, syrup, grenadine in a good way. Syrupy body. Very warming. Extremely expensive, nice for a small taster but not repeat drinking. Very candy, desert-like. Extreme & interesting + highly memorable but too expensive experience.

UPDATED: JAN 20, 2015 Bottle .
Pours rad / brown , almost no foam . Smells intencly sweet . Thick mouthfeel . Sugary . Dark fruits , sugary , swert , syrupy, very heavy , very intence . Totaly woth the hype ! 
Nice ! 

Rerate. Same text,  gave 0,2 upgrade since i was amazed by this one a second time.  Fantastic beer!

I had this on-tap at the Kuhnhenn Brewery as part of a paddle.

Appearance: I was shocked to see a little, tiny ring of pink/purple head on this beer. I had seen a few reviews of this beer, and it looked just like a dark black/purple/red color and nothing else. The lowpoint of this beer, but its also the part of the beer that matters least.

Smell: Flawless. This really smells like a urinal cake... in the BEST way possible. Maybe that wont do it for you. Alright. It smells like the raspberry that you whiff out of raspberry filled chocolates. This is just full of raspberries with maybe a hint of chocolate... whatever it is, this smells outstanding. Candle, please?

Taste: I noticed that some people called this syrupy thick. Overly sweet. Too much to handle. Really, I thought it was nearly perfect. This beer is most definitely a dessert beer (almost something youd pour over a vanilla ice cream... actually, that sounds fantastic), but whatever you wanna call it, its outstanding. Massive raspberry, but its not so tart/sweet that it becomes cloying.. easy for me to say, considering I had about a 3oz sample of it. Honestly, I didnt find this to be medicinal at all... Theres also slight chocolate note that gives this a needed extra dimension of flavor... yum. I also have to commend Kuhnhenn for the feel of this beer, as its not super carbonated (so it doesnt drink like a pop... though I wouldnt expect that given the ABV), and its not syrupy sweet (which I was afraid of after seeing reviews and the ABV). As for the alcohol in the flavor, I dont get it. All I get is a slight burn in my nasal cavity after I take a sip.

This is a damn expensive beer (About $15 for 6oz at the brewery), but you should include this as part of your sample paddle. This is something that any beer/wine/mead drinker would enjoy, I think.

Shared this bad boy at DLD. 2012 vintage served in a Deschutes snifter.

A: Pours a brownish, reddish color with a pretty still body. No real head forms on the pour.

S: Lots of sweet booze and malt with blast of smashed raspberries. Bready malts make up most of the flavor profile in the nose.

T: Tons of sweet raspberry. Much more than nose conveyed. Very jammy in nature with a little boozy heat. A mild burn is there with a heavy, bready malt profile to back it up.

M: Low carbonation with a chewy texture and mouthfeel. Sweet and hot on the finish.

O: This was good, but it definitely needs some time. The boozy notes are right up front and need some time to settle in.

Serving type: bottle

05-19-2013 13:35:29

Sample from bottle. Pours a pale, clear-looking red with no head at all. A big raspberry aroma jumps out of the glass. The taste brings forth more raspberry but a surprising and pleasant amount of chewy toffee and chocolate. Feels a bit syrupy and medicinal but the flavours work with that. This was very impressive.

2007 bottle graciously shared by Matt B -- thanks! Pours dark amber, no head. Aroma brings out slight tootsie roll, caramel and chocolate. Raspberry is in there, too, which for some reason surprises me after 6 years (despite the name. Taste: Raspberry flavor seems to hit then immediately evaporate (pretty cool, actually - like the taste being carried with the aroma immediately evaporates upon touching the tongue). Raisin and prune follow. Alcohol gets there right at the tail end, and it finishes just a shade tart. Really impressively smooth. Overall: This was a completely unexpected treat.

(Draught at Beer Temple, Amsterdam, 26 July 2013) Dark red colour with brief head. Fruity, malty nose with notes of raspberries, vanilla and treacle. Fruity, malty taste with raspberries, caramel, vanilla, candy sugar and a sweet finish with a slight raspberry tartness. Full body, quite thick and oily. Very sweet and slightly sticky. Its thick, sweet and dominated by raspberries. So its not the most complex or subtly balanced. But its still quite lovely.

How: Draught.
Where: Beer Temple, Amsterdam.
Appearance: Dark red colour with a small pink head.
Aroma: Lots of raspberries, some spices, caramel..
Body: Full bodied with a low carbonation.
Flavour: Raspberries, waffles with whipped cream and jam, some spices and a bit of alcohol.
Comment: Full of flavour. Balanced. Really good.

Ruby red pour with quickly dissipating head. Aroma reminds me of a sort of spiked raspberry jam...in a good way. Big raspberry flavor upfront with the sweet and tart notes coming through nicely. Slow sipper, like drinking dessert. It finishes a bit hot but not bad considering the abv. Very impressive and tasty.

Bottle - much thanks to NorthernBrewer! Pours ruby clear red with a fast diminishing tiny pink head. Aroma is chocolate and raspberry. Flavor is about the same, only lightly sweet to my great surprise, and actually fairly bitter on the finish. Medium body, liquer-like in terms of its head and presence, but not its relative low sweetness. Finishes on the dry side.

Bottle. Pour is a dark ruby red with very little carbonation and no head. Aroma is chocolate and loads of raspberries. Flavor is.raspberries, chocolate and there is some heat/booze to this. Really a nice beer, would pair well with lots of different food.
Poured a deep reddish brown with no real head. Aroma of sweet raspberry. Medium body, flavour is quite vanilla smooth, like raspberry ice cream. Dangerously drinkable for the strength.

UPDATED: AUG 10, 2013 Draught. Pours reddish brown with little to no head. Aroma is raspberry, chocolate and molasses. Taste is medium sweet, little sour. Nice and complex, very deep flavour. No carbonation.

Drank 2013 on draft next to a sample of 2004(thanks jeppe)

Dark brown with a cherry red hugh. No head and a whisp of lacing left on the glass.

Nose was sweet raspberry, chocolate and sugary caramel

Flavor was very sweet, candy like, warmth from alcohol, with a viscous mouthfeel
Poured at brewery. Dark maroon color. Smells of berry, caramel and chocolate. Taste delivers on the smell. A bit bitter in the mouth and some boozyness. Great finish. Top notch.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. A big treat! The aroma? Oh, then aroma! If heaven has a smell, I might just think it could be something like this. So sweet and raspberry infused that its hard to find enough of them superlatives. Cherries and raspberries in a amazing harmony. It just smells as good as a beer can smell. Its really warming in their throat with both sweet and slightly acidic raspberries. In a way it can remind a bit of a sourned mead added enormous amount of raspberries. A flavor bomb of the highest class there is. The warming sensation is just lingering in the throat forever. Pure class! 03.05.2013

On tap @ Beer Temple. Clear, deep red color. Thin head, soapy, pink-ish. Aromas: raspberries, cassis, syrup. Very syruppy and sweet retronasal. Flavor is sweet with a fruity sourness. Alcohol feel is quite strong, warming. Body is quite full, syruppy. Flavors linger, but no new flavor. Very sweet, but quite nice.

On tap at the beer temple. 
Thin creamy pink head. Clear burgundy pour. Raspberry with a lingrring slight bitter aftertaste. Nice brew. Alcohol well hidden.
Saved this one for a special occasion. 2012 bottle. Really enjoyed sharing this one with friends. Strong raspberry and chocolate flavor. Great flavor and mouthfeel.

2007 Vintage. Pours a ruby brown color with no visible bubbles. The nose is complex and inviting with ripe raspberry notes, port wine, cocoa, wet wood and even a touch of toffee. The palate follows the nose with a nice balance between sweet raspberry fruit and deep chocolate earthiness. Really smooth and silky on the mouthfeel with great flavor profiles from front to back.

[187ml bottle, courtesy of cgarvieuk][2007 vintage] Tiny, old bottle of what looks like high-school homebrew. Turns out to be this jewel, long forgotten. Opaque, headless, rimless. Strong, sweet, oaked fruit on the nose. Big Black Forest Gateaux flavour. Chocolate and raspberry. Hugely drinkable, albeit in such a small bottle. Wondrous [21062013]

Bottle from Mike, thanks! Pours a brownish red with no carbonation. Aroma is a raspberry punch to the face with slight chocolate/roast notes. Bittersweet baking chocolate. Taste is raspberry forward with more desert wine and chocolate notes. At first there is a harsh heat down your throat but quickly goes away as the beer warms. A nice sipping beer but not exactly the right beer for a hot afternoon.
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text: Pours a ruby/plum color with a finger of tan head. Aroma has nice raspberry nites and a choclate/tootsie roll note. Flavor is just like a choclate covered raspberry...more fruit than chocolate. Mouthfeel is medium/full and slick with a roasty chocolate finish that hints at raspberry...warms nicely. Very tasty dessert beer and hides the ABV nicely.

Bottle, big thanks to Craig. Pours dark red with no head . 2007 vintage, smell is slightly oxidised, sherry notes, prune, fig, dates, chocolate and cake mix. Taste is very rich, slightly oxidised again, chocolate, brownie, cake mix, some raspberry. Thick and sweet. Very nice but I get the feeling that a lot of the raspberry has been lost.

2012 Vintage
Aroma is dominated by raspberries. Some tart berry notes but overall fairly sweet. There is a slight medicinal note to it, but really faint. Light caramel and moderate chocolate malt notes help balance the raspberry. A bit of an alcohol note as it warms. 
Pours a surprisingly clear, but not perfectly clear burnt amber with brown notes to it. Small thin tan head that quickly recedes to the edges and disappears. 
Flavor starts with sweet raspberry with a light caramel and moderate chocolate note, but the beer is definitely dominated by sweet raspberry. The raspberry is similar to jam or a pastry. Medium bitterness and a moderately strong alcohol note in the finish. No medicinal flavor. 
Mouthfeel is medium full bodied with very low carbonation. Low astringency and medium high alcohol warmth. Fairly sweet and somewhat cloying. 
Overall I'm not sure how I feel about this beer as a fresh beer. The raspberry flavors are too dominate, and fairly sweet. I think it will likely age well and help balance out the fruit notes. Age should also help add some complexity and mellow the alcohol heat. I expect an eisbock to have more malt character. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sample at CBC 2013.

Dark hazy maber colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of raspberry, alcohol, malt and vanilla.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2014 12.7oz bottle, thanks to umich03jm. 2012 vintage, labeled 15.5% ABV. Shared with DanielCoor and robotopera. Clear dark red color. No head or lace, but some legs... Nice color to the body. Surprisingly little alcohol burn for the ABV. I was expecting heat, based of what Ive been hearing. But it tastes like it could pass for 13%. Sweeter taste, not really cloying, though. A good tartness, as well. Big body. Very light, if any carbonation. Lightly dry in the finish. Awesome aroma. Huge raspberry. Some chocolate in there. Super long, candy-sweet (in a good way) big long raspberry aftertaste. Very fascinating beer. Very interesting and different. Only thing I can say it seems close in flavor to are the big New Glarus fruit beers Ive tried, sans being frozen. Glad to have had the chance to try and share this. Definitely took my buzz to a new plateau as well, deceptively easy to drink for the size of the ABV. 8/3/8/4/16Update rate 7/3/14: 2004 6.3oz bottle. Thanks to Tom for sharing. This should be interesting to try. Brown color, slight red. Thin khaki head. Loose lace. Looks kind of magical. Chocolate, dark fruit in the nose. Raspberry chocolate syrup. Light alcohol warmth. In the flavor, alcohol is pretty well hidden. No burn or bite at all. Some oxidization flavors, though. Medium to bigger body. Light slick, then drying in the finish. Very light carbonation. Surprisingly drinkable. Pretty damn impressive stuff... A lot better than expected. 8/4/7/4/16 [scores from original 2013 rating kept unchanged]

Pours a nice clear purple color. Aroma is great of raspberry and alcohol. Great flavor is nice and sweet of malt, raspberry, tart and alcohol. Mouth feel is tart and carbonation is average. This is an amazing beer.

2012 thanks lee first off if you havent had this beer get ready to have your face changed as soon as you open the bottle. pours a fruit punch thin red no real head may a thin line whitish nose is crazy raspberry and cherry skins taste was unlike any beer i have ever tasted it was thick but not in the liquid of it it was like chocolate raspberry truffle stuffed in your mouth then an alcohol jumps rite in there at the end what a roller coaster of a beer

Bottle 2012 pours a clear ruby with a thin khaki head. Aroma of raspberry juice and tootsie rolls. Taste similar to aroma a raspberry tootsie roll with a punch of alcohol on the finish. This is delicious!

Tap at CBC 2013 - Copenhagen. Pours dark, matte red with a small, foamy head. Lovely nose, lots of rich, ripe raspberry, some berry pits. Big sweet flavor with moderate alcohol, juicy raspberries, cherries, faint tartness. Full bodied with fine, creamy carbonation. Warm finish, very sweet but not cloying, with mild bitter earthy berry pits and apple skin, some further rich, fairly sugary raspberries. Great beverage.
On tap @CBC13. Hazy dark amber, almost brown, with small offwhite head. Aroma rich in fruits; malts, loads of raspberry and candy notes. Flavor of malt, rich raspberries, candy and alcohol
Dark red pour with very little head.  Aroma of red vines, lots of raspberries.  Taste is raspberry and chocolate flavor with some alcohol booziness.  Enjoyable.

Strong aroma of fruit (almost like Kool Aid), with a thin red appearance, strong raspberry taste and lingering warm mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

CBC 2013. Dark red/pink color, nice head. Big fruit-bomb in the aroma, red fruit and sweet candy thats overruling the malt backbone. (Too) sweet, loads of red fruit, alcohol is well hidden. Not bad, but highly overrated imho.

2012 bottle. Big thanks to my brother for this one. Deep burgundy with no head. Candy, raspberry and vanilla aromas. Chocolate and raspberry. Really syrupy. A bit disappointed at the slight medicinal syrup flavor. Hides the ABV amazingly well.

Draught @ CBC. Pours hazy dark reddish brown with a small offwhite head. Aroma of rich malts, sweets, sweet fruity, loads of raspberry. Flavor of malt, heavy rich raspberries, sweets, liquerlike, boozy. Full body, soft carbonation, sweet finish with warming alcohol. 030513
On tap at CBC. Dark red colour, similar to red wine. Small off-white head. Raspberry and sweet aroma, like a gummy or syrup. Sweet taste, slightly acid with some raspberry. It also tasted like candy.

Sample at CBC 2013, Friday.

Reddish with a nice pink head. Lovely aroma of raspberries, some caramel and something that reminded of "gelehallon" (Swedish candy). About the same in the sweet but excellent taste. Vinous and slightly sour in the finish. Also notes of chocolate. I can understand why this beer has high ratings. I must drink this again!

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2014 [5/3/13] Draught at Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2013. Dark ruby-brown. Aroma of malt, brown sugar, lots of berries liqueur, other dark fruits and alcohol. Sweet flavor, candy-ish and liqueur-ish, with lots of malt, caramel and raspberries and a very alcoholic finish. Medium-full-bodied, kinda syrupy. Not bad at all, but very sweet and boozy, a bit too much for my liking.
Sample at CBC 2013. Amazing appearance, with an incredibly complex flavor of hops, raspberry and sweet fruit. Amazing!

Draught at CBC 13. Hazy deep copper liquid with small to medium light brown head. Aroma of raspberries, vanilla, toffee, caramel, candy and raw sugar. Taste is medium sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of raspberries, toffee, bread, biscuit and dark fruit. Full bodied with low to medium carbonation and really sticky mouthfeel. Awesome stuff, lives up to the hype.

Sample at CBC. Creamy lightbrown good mostly lasting head. Amber colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma with exstremely nice raspberry notes. Heavy bitter very powerfull complex flavor. Long excellent heavy bitter finish. Fantastic palate. Just worldclass.

UPDATED: JUN 27, 2013 On tap at CBC, pours a pinkish ruby red with a small beige head. Aroma of intense raspberries--so fresh and potent, no sign of alcohol - exceptional aromatics. Flavour brings out liqueur-coated pungent raspberries, and alcohol. Like a liqueurized raspberry purée. Very potent, with a very warming effect. Delicious stuff.

Vintage 07 bottle. 187mL bottle, pours a pinkish ruby red with almost no head. Nose brings out raspberry-coated chocolate, raspberry purée, and liqueur. Flavour brings out rich notes of raspberry purée, rich caramel and chocolate, and even a slight tartness. Amazing that the raspberries have held up this well after six years. The flavours are better integrated than on the new version, perhaps due to the aging rather than a different recipe. The finish is on raspberries and liqueur, with only a slight warming effect (less so than the boxier new version). Amazing stuff - the better of the two versions Ive had.

From tap, at CBC 2012. Hazy orange red with a frothy tan head. Intriguing nutty aromas of toffee and peanutbutter mixed with raspberry accents. Medium to heavy sweet flavor, leathery, fruity, with a creamy chocolatey texture and very soft carbonation. Medium bitter finish. One of a kind, and without a doubt the most interesting fruit beer Ive had.

Tap @ CBC2013. Slight hazy reddish copper color, short head. Aroma of lots of fruit, raspberry, caramel, some wood, bit alcohol. Very fruity in taste as well, sirupy. Almost like a fruit liquor. Its one of the top 50 beers back in the old days already, so it has build a reputation for me. Its very nice, but it doesnt live up to the epic expectation. Good I usually dont have expectations anymore with beers.

UPDATED: OCT 7, 2016 Favorite of CBC 2013. Was really aware of the hype and I thought this would never ever live up to, I was wrong! Raspberries, leather, sweets, dough, loads going on in the complex aroma. Very big and full bodied. Heavy sweet raspberry finish. Insane brew
Draught @ CBC 2013. Hazy reddish color, small beige head. Smell and taste malts, a lot of sweetness and raspberry with a touch of sourness and alcohol in the finish. Full body, medium carbonation.

Draft at CBC 2013.  Pours hazy red brown with a ring tan head.  Aroma of raspberries, toffee, caramel, red berries, cough medicine and leather.  Flavor is heavy sweet and light bitter, just too sweet for my liking.  Full bodied with soft carbonation.
Cloudy brown, almost no head. Aroma is sweet. Fruity, quitte sweet fruity.flavor is sweet malty, sweet fruity, too boozy

Draught at CBC 2013. Clear amber/reddish beer with a nice pinkish head. Great raspberry aroma, caramel, chocolate notes, strawberries, sourish, red currant, leather notes. Raspberry flavor, chocolate, strawberries, vinous, sweetish yet tart, leather, vanilla notes, warming alcohol. Huge body and a very pleasant raspberry and chocolate finish.

Sample @ CBC13.
Pours dark hazy red color with with minimal head. Aroma of intense raspberries, ripe fruits, strawberry and caramel notes. Flavour of raspberries, some dark currants and some sugar and honey notes. Quite overwhelming, not too sweet and quite balanced. Excellent.
4227

Fantastic burgundy in color. Nose is raspberries, vanilla, some strawberries. Mouth is very complex with raspberries up front that gives way to vanilla, butterscotch, almonds and some liquor sweetness. Just fabulous! At CBC 2013.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours murky red amber with low tan head. Aroma is just wow! Raspberries, deep, rich raspberries. Taste is just out of this world, sweet, again raspberries, portlike, cake. Light bitterness and sourness to round it off. Body is medium creamy with soft carbonation and huge lingering finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours brown red with low off white head
Aromas explodes of raspberries
Very nice taste balanced between easpberries and sweetness from malts. A sensation!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ CBC2013. Pours a beautiful ruby red colour with a white head. Aroma of strong tart raspberries, caramel and alcohol. Flavour is very intense with raspberries, caramel, alcohol, wood and bitterness. Full bodied, thick mouthfeel and a heavy, sweet, raspberry finish. Truly a heavy eisbock.

Draught @ CBC 2013

Pours dark reddish brown with a smooth white head. Aroma of sweet syrupy malts, tart berries, some spices and wooden notes. Taste is sweet, sticky as malty with some tart berries, vanilla and oak. Finish is sticky and malty with some raspberry juice notes and sweet syrup. Quite untypical, perhaps a tad too sweet for my taste.

A cool brew. Aroma is big time raspberry and light chocolate notes. Pour is purple/red with not much for a head. Nice color, though. Flavor was super sweet raspberry with a light chocolate and medicine flavor. Pretty good but not what I expected.

2012 batch - thanks OmegaX. This batch was a tad stronger... like 15.5% stronger. The body poured a tad oily, showing little signs of carbonation in the deep red hue it had. This brew had an intense marriage of chocolate and raspberries in the aroma, it was almost thick as well. The taste was fantastic; bittersweet raspberries, soft carbonation, smooth texture, and a kiss of chocolate in the finish. What a unique experience this was!

2012 Vintage. Thanks to Adam for sharing this! The pours deep bread with absolutely no head whatsoever. The nose is bright earthy red jam. Big, expressive sweet raspberry. Rich caramel and glazed donut. Strong stewed prunes and Dr Pepper soda. Big, sweet aromas. The taste is more strong raspberry. Hints of robitussin. Very thick sludgy chocolate malts. Some burnt caramel and toffee. Moderate booziness creeps in after a few sips. Rich, viscous body. Full. Soft carbonation. Overall, a pretty cool beer. I certainly couldnt do a 375ml bottle of this by myself.

Poured from a 375 ml bottle shared by Josh. Huge thanks! Pours a translucent ruby colorwith no head. The aroma is all brown sugar and raspberry jam. Awesome! Tastes like a bunch of raspberry jam. Its a heavy beer because of how sweet it is, but dammit, I think I could drink this stuff by the gallons. Great beer, and definitely deserving of all the hype behind it.

Reddish raspberry color, nearly no head out of the waxed bottle.  Smells like sharp, tart raspberry and booze.  i also get some chocolate on the nose which is interesting compared to the color.  Drinkable but boozey.  lots of raspberry and boozey sweetness  Someone said it reminds them of a raspberry tootsie roll.  Really interesting, never had anything like this one.
2012 bottle.  Pours a dark red, resembles more that of wine than a beer.  The aroma is strong of sweet raspberry.  The taste is very sweet.  Lots of character as well.  This is top notch for sure.

One of the Holy Grail (!) from a trade with umich03jm. Pours a sort of deep copper maroon color. Very low head, and carbonation is mild. Aroma is a balance of sweet raspberry and chocolate; wishing for more aroma. Flavor is fairly sweet and intense raspberry, chocolate, and some alcohol, but its well hidden considering the ABV. This reminds me of eating a raspberry truffle. Love how this lingers on the palate with these really nice flavors and a little tartness. Great sipping beer. Unique, and impressive that the brewer could pull this off without the beer tasting artificial or weird. Awesome to have been able to try this. Thanks, Jason!

UPDATED: APR 6, 2013 2012 bottle thanks to Beerman6686. Pours a wine-like red without any head. Looks like wine sitting in the glass. Aroma of raspberries, alcohol, chocolate. The taste is tart and sweet at parts. Smooth drinkability with a smooth mouth feel. Not seeing the top 50 thing though.

2013. Raspberry puree in the nose, reminds me of a sherry. Boozy, fruit-infused flavor profile. Can't taste the chocolate in this batch, was far more prevalent in the '04 I had last year. That bottle was completely different, as this fresh batch is more true to the Eisbock style.

UPDATED: MAR 27, 2013 Incredible, joyous, emphatic aroma.  Framboise & watermelon jolly rancher & cotton candy.  Catches the light and shines in appearance.  Raspberry pink hard candy in color.  And then I tasted.... cough syrup.  Very, very medicinal.  Not nearly worth they hype, let alone the cost.  Disgustingly cloying, literally in the way of a cough syrup.  Arguably one of the better smelling brews Ive ever sniffed...

Clear ruby color with a thin white head that diminishes to a thin rim. Aroma is intense raspberries with some alcohol. Flavor is very intense like melted raspberry candy nice sweet warming aftertaste. Full palatepacking a punch but not excessively boozy but drinking 6oz of this take a while. like never had it before.

A - Tons of raspberry and alcohol.

Ap - Beautifully dark and thick. Deep red.

T - Medium sweetness. Like eating a raspberry. Amazing.

P - Thick and almost flat. Sweet-tart finish that lingers.

O - Incredible. Worthy of the hype. Get it!
tap at 2013 michigan winter beer fest. mahogany with big fruity aroma. raspberries and chocolate and lots of alcohol warmth (i think this was listed at 15%). really intense beer.

2007 bottle. from trade with Sarro - and also my birthday rating this year! :-) Pours a hazy nut brown body with a tiny white head and a few bubbles on the surface, fading quite quickly. Nose is amazingly thick fumes of oxidized caramel malts, toffee, alcohol, Norwegian"brown cheese" (caramelized goat/cow milk cheese) wood and subtle raspberry tones in the back, along with some Madeira and port wine tones. Very nice. Taste is sweet caramel and toffee tones up front, fading into Norwegian brown cheese notes with additional hints of molasses and alcohol, before a solid dose of raspberries - both of the sweet and tart kind - round it all up in a very elegant fashion. Thick, viscous and deliciously oily mouthfeel, soft but present carbonation. A really original and great sipper; glad I could get my hands on this treat; definitely a good choice for my birthday rating! :-)

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ shared with my father to celebrate his 60th birthday.

Appearance: Dark red with almost no head. Quite beautiful.

Aroma: Raspberries, Malt, Grain, Fudge, Vanilla.

Taste: Malt, Chocolate, Raspberries, Caramel, Vanilla.

Palate: A solid malt base with a bit of tartness from the berries. Smooth and complex and supertasty.

A truly interesting eisbocks and one of the better beers ive had lately.

6 ounce draft at the brewery. Pours a dark raspberry color with no head. Aroma of raspberry and chocolate. Sweet taste of raspberry and chocolate.  Mouthfeel is medium. Did not detect much of any alcohol in the aroma or taste, which is good considering it is 15.5% I think. Glad I was able to try it and can see why it is sought after, but at $30 for a 12 ounce bottle, The financial guilt would detract from the enjoyment somewhat. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Very sweet not for the real beer drinker, its almost like it should of came with an umbrella

I have tasted many of the best beers in the world, and the 2.5 glasses of KRE I enjoyed with my wife last night at the brewery jumped to the top of my all-time favs. So much so that I bought 6 bottles @ $30/12 oz bottle.

Holy Beergasm!! Easily the best aroma of any beer Ive ever enjoyed. Raspberry and chocolate are so intense that its like getting a scent of heaven.

Appearance is a beautiful reddish brown with a simple head.

Taste attacks the palate like a mugger in the night. It is so amazing how smooth the 15.5% slides down your throat without the heat of the alcohol.

My palate was overwhelmed with joy for 15 mins after I finished my glass. I literally had no clue a beer could do this to me.

Overall? Simply amazing. I LOVE the worlds best stouts and IPAs, but I would take this beer over so many of my favorite beers. It is going to take some ridiculous discipline to not drink the bottles I brought home that Im "hoping" to cellar.

Draft at Kuhnhenn.  Pours a deep dark red color with a small pink head that fades normally.  Aroma at first is dominated by rich raspberries and port wine but chocolate comes out strong as it warms.  Taste is chocolate covered raspberries, delicious.  Tastes a bit like a fine wine but richer and with a subtle carbonation.  Finish has no alcohol heat and just a touch of booziness.  As great as this is right now I cant help but feel like this will get better.  It tastes just a bit fresh and I think the flavors will become more complex in a few years.

Bouteille, courtoisie de Hogtownharry ou Blankboy. Nez fruité (framboises, notesde raisins vineux et de mûres), malté de caramel toffee aux notes rôties, léger de chocolat avec notes de cassonade, de vanille et alcool doux. Ronde en bouche et peu pétillante avec une texture assez liquoreuse. Goût fruité aux petites notes sûres (framboises, léger de mûres et de prunes, notes de raisins vineux  présent en arrière-goût toute la gorgée) avec des traces de vanille lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté de caramel toffee sucré aux notes rôties, moyen de chocolat noir ainsi quun léger goût rappelant le sirop dérable, la cassonade et la mélasse sucrée puis une finale légèrement amère dalcool liquoreux réchauffant et aux petites notes boiséees.
